info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elkhart, St. Joseph, northwestern Kosciusko, northeastern Marshall and south central Cass Counties through 330 AM EDT... At 244 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Edwardsburg to Gulivoire Park to 6 miles southeast of New Carlisle. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Elkhart and Simonton Lake around 250 AM EDT. Osceola around 255 AM EDT. Dunlap, Bristol and Lakeville around 300 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wakarusa, Nappanee, Bremen, Goshen, New Paris, Milford, Millersburg and Syracuse. This includes Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 78 and 97. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM EDT for north central, northeastern and northwestern Indiana...and southwestern Michigan.
